there's cucumber salad and you can grow

water in dirt one of the most
interesting I had back in 2004 was in

odd combination of flavors and textures
really nice with rice vinegar and ginger
and then as I often do with salads I
adapted it to make it a bigger meal put
some scallops on top which almost always
works you can do this with a knife but
the best tool is a cheap mandoline 20
bucks and it'll be your best friend
until you have the inevitable accident
and slice your finger but after that
you'll be more careful and cucumbers by
the way are the ideal vegetable to cut
on a mandolin because they're the
perfect shape you cannot get slices that
then with a knife unless you really know
what you're doing the key is to keep
moving your fingers away from the blade
and to accept the fact that you are not
going to cut this down to the absolute
last millimeter you know the blade is
sharp which is the idea so you know when
there's that much left just get rid of
it so now you have this beautiful bowl

pretty much the same kind of cucumber
salad your grandma used to make
but with ginger vinegar we're using rice
vinegar here a little bit of sugar salt
and this is grated ginger it's about a
2-inch piece
peeled and grated makes a lot of ginger
okay you want this to sit in the
refrigerator for a good half hour and an
hour is better the point is you need to
let this rest for a while the vinegar
needs to break down some of the cucumber
or the sugar needs to sweeten it and
break down a little bit itself the salt
is gonna draw some of the moisture out
of the cucumber's and they're going to
become crisper and more tender
at the same time okay so we're gonna
cook scallops now hot pan with a little
bit of oil and you're gonna have to cook
these in batches because you really want
to brown them nicely so nice sea

really sizzle when they hit it probably
cook six at once I'm only gonna cook
three cuz I'm gonna eat this myself one
or two minutes per side that's it
because they're really if their best
when they're rare in the center a little
salt and pepper the best scallops for
this are absolutely sea scallops because
you want nice size and if they're even
bigger than this you can cut them in
half through their equators but these
are sort of typical of the size you see
when they're ready to turn they'll
release themselves pretty much and
they'll be nicely browned as they are
here so as I said a minute or at the
most two per side nicely done turn the

oil I'm sort of to glaze the pan with

up some of their liquid that liquid is
gonna clean the bottom of the pan of
those wonderful scallop juices and the

with half a teaspoon or so of turmeric
which is largely for color so look
beautiful tender but still a little on

turn that off into the cucumber salad

some toasted sesame seeds so just take
